evidence: Spin echo is one of the most fundamental sequences in MRI, so watching those demonstrations will help reinforce how a ninety-degree pulse and a one-eighty-degree pulse work together to refocus the signal.
Gradient echo is a variation where gradients are used to generate echoes instead of a one-eighty-degree pulse.
As we discussed, slice selection is how we target a specific region of the body by combining a magnetic gradient with the RF pulse.
